10. Find without using logarithm tables, the value of 
Log327 – Log1/464 
Log31/81 
A. 7/4 B. –7/4 C. –3/2 
D. 7/3 E. –1/4 
 
11. A variable point P(x, y) traces a graph in a two 
dimensional plane. (0, -3) is one position of P. If x 
increases by 1 unit, y increases by 4 units. The equation 
of the graph is 
A. -3 = y + 4/ x + 1 B. 4y = -3 + x 
C. y/x = -3/4 D. y + 3 = 4x 
E. 4y = x + 3 
 
12. A trader in a country where their currency ‘MONT’ (M) 
is in base five bought 103 (5) oranges at M14 (5) each. If 
he sold the oranges at M24 (5) each, what will be his 
gain? 
19.  In a racing competition. Musa covered a distance of 5xkm 
in the first hour and (x + 10)km in the next hour. He was 
second to Ngozi who covered a total distance of 118km 
in the two hours. Which of the following inequalities is 
correct? 
A. 0 < -x < 15 B. –3 < x < 3 
C. 15 < x < 18 D. 0 < x < 15 
E. 0 < x < 18 
 
20. 2x + 3y = 1 and y = x – 2y = 11, find (x + y) 
A. 5 B. –3 C. 8 
D. 2 E. 2 
21.  Tunde and Shola can do a piece of work in 18days. 
Tunde can do it alone in x days, whilst Shola takes 15 
days longer to do it alone. Which of the following 
equations is satisfied by x? 
A. x2– 5x– 18 = 0 B. x2 – 20x+360 =0 
A. M103 (5) B. M1030(5) C. M102 (5) C. x2 - 21x– 270 =0 D. 2x2+ 42x– 190 =0 
D. M2002(5)

in two distinct points. If one of them is (5,5), find the 
other

16. Factorise 6x2 – 14x - 12    4a2 – 9b2, a3 + 27b3, (4a + 6b)2 
A. 2(x + 3) (3x - 2) B. 6(x - 2) (x + 1) A. 4a + 6b B. 4a – 6b

E. (3x + 4) (2x + 3)   E. none
